Package chess

Class King

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Piece
      • chess.King
  • public class King
extends Piece
    This class models the King chess piece, which is an extension of the abstract Piece object.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      boolean leftCastling
      This field is set to true if this King is able to castle on the left-hand side.
      boolean rightCastling
      This field is set to true if this King is able to castle on the right-hand side.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      King​(java.lang.String color)
      This is the constructor for the King Piece.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean blackCastling​(int startRow, int endRow, int startColumn, int endColumn, Tile[][] board)
      This method checks to see if castling is able to be done for the black player.
      boolean getleftCastling()
      This is a getter method to return if it is possible for the king to castle on the left.
      boolean getrightCastling()
      This is a getter method to return if it is possible for the king to castle on the right.
      boolean isValidMove​(int startRow, int startColumn, int endRow, int endColumn, Tile[][] board)
      This method checks to see if the move made by the king is in the correct motion and within the correct amount of allowed spaces.
      Tile[][] updateBoard​(int startRow, int startColumn, int endRow, int endColumn, Tile[][] board)
      This method updates the chessboard based on the move that was input.
      boolean whiteCastling​(int startRow, int endRow, int startColumn, int endColumn, Tile[][] board)
      This method checks to see if castling is able to be done for the white player.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • leftCastling

        public boolean leftCastling
        This field is set to true if this King is able to castle on the left-hand side.

      • rightCastling

        public boolean rightCastling
        This field is set to true if this King is able to castle on the right-hand side.

    • Constructor Detail

      • King

        public King​(java.lang.String color)
        This is the constructor for the King Piece. It accepts either black or white, and returns an instance of the King object.
        Parameters:
        color - accepts either "white" or "black"

    • Method Detail

      • getleftCastling

        public boolean getleftCastling()
        This is a getter method to return if it is possible for the king to castle on the left.
        Returns:
        true if left castling is possible.

      • getrightCastling

        public boolean getrightCastling()
        This is a getter method to return if it is possible for the king to castle on the right.
        Returns:
        true if right castling is possible.

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove​(int startRow,
                           int startColumn,
                           int endRow,
                           int endColumn,
                           Tile[][] board)
        This method checks to see if the move made by the king is in the correct motion and within the correct amount of allowed spaces.
        Parameters:
        startRow - Row before move
        startColumn - Column before move
        endRow - Row after move
        endColumn - Column after move
        board - board after move
        Returns:
        true if move is able to be made.

      • whiteCastling

        public boolean whiteCastling​(int startRow,
                             int endRow,
                             int startColumn,
                             int endColumn,
                             Tile[][] board)
        This method checks to see if castling is able to be done for the white player.
        Parameters:
        startRow - Row before move
        startColumn - Column before move
        endRow - Row after move
        endColumn - Column after move
        board - board after move
        Returns:
        true if castling is able to be done.

      • blackCastling

        public boolean blackCastling​(int startRow,
                             int endRow,
                             int startColumn,
                             int endColumn,
                             Tile[][] board)
        This method checks to see if castling is able to be done for the black player.
        Parameters:
        startRow - Row before move
        startColumn - Column before move
        endRow - Row after move
        endColumn - Column after move
        board - board after move
        Returns:
        true if castling is able to be done.

      • updateBoard

        public Tile[][] updateBoard​(int startRow,
                            int startColumn,
                            int endRow,
                            int endColumn,
                            Tile[][] board)
        This method updates the chessboard based on the move that was input. This will also execute castling on either side for either player if it is possible and if it is proposed.
        Parameters:
        startRow - Row before move
        startColumn - Column before move
        endRow - Row after move
        endColumn - Column after move
        board - board after move
        Returns:
        chessboard which is updated with the proposed move.
